Bulldogs on the Big Screen:

Starting with tonight’s home football game, when our Bulldogs will host visiting New Brighton, fans will be able to bring their own chairs and join us on the practice field to watch the game, which will be projected onto a 20-foot by 20-foot screen on the back wall of the middle school gymnasium and feature play-by-play announcing.

To provide for social distancing, each family group will be assigned to a 10-foot circle that has been pre-marked. All fans will be required to wear their masks at all times. No smoking or alcohol will be permitted. Circles will be assigned on a first-come, first-served basis until we reach the 250-spectator capacity.

This was made possible through generous donations. Herm Sayre of Vincent Lighting donated the big screen. NorthBridge Community Church donated the use of a large projector. And Freedom’s Maintenance and Technology Departments, under the direction of Mr. Gary Mortimer and Mrs. Marie Dohanich worked tirelessly to bring this together.

Kickoff at Bulldog Stadium is scheduled for 7:30 p.m.

On-site purchases must be paid in cash or by money order (checks cannot be accepted at this time), and exact change is strongly recommended, as we may not be able to make change at the point of purchase.

If you have any questions, please email yearbook@freedomarea.org.

Thank you for your patience and support. We look forward to seeing you this week!

This ties the Freedom record for most students to advance to the state championship, first set in the 2016-2017 school year.
